message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class CourseAttendance {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String input = "LAWS303 RHLT1   10  84  AITKEN  WU  LAWS314 RHLT3   15  2   PARADZA VISSER  LAWS329 EALT006 6   62  AITKEN  WILSON  LAWS334 HMLT105 2   43  ANDREW  INKSTER LAWS334 HMLT206 2   62  JULIAN  YOUNG   LAWS340 RHLT1   11  87  AL  YANG";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, " ");

        // Create a HashMap to store the attendance data
        HashMap<String, HashMap<String, Integer>> attendanceMap = new HashMap<>();

        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String courseCode = st.nextToken();
            String dayOfMonth = st.nextToken();
            int headCount = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());

            // Check if the dayOfMonth already exists in the attendanceMap
            if (attendanceMap.containsKey(dayOfMonth)) {
                // Get the inner HashMap for the dayOfMonth
                HashMap<String, Integer> courseAttendance = attendanceMap.get(dayOfMonth);
                // Add/update the headCount for the courseCode
                courseAttendance.put(courseCode, headCount);
            } else {
                // Create a new inner HashMap for the dayOfMonth
                HashMap<String, Integer> courseAttendance = new HashMap<>();
                // Add the headCount for the courseCode
                courseAttendance.put(courseCode, headCount);
                // Add the inner HashMap to the attendanceMap
                attendanceMap.put(dayOfMonth, courseAttendance);
            }
        }

        // Print the attendance data
        for (String dayOfMonth : attendanceMap.keySet()) {
            System.out.println("Day: " + dayOfMonth);
            HashMap<String, Integer> courseAttendance = attendanceMap.get(dayOfMonth);
            for (String courseCode : courseAttendance.keySet()) {
                int headCount = courseAttendance.get(courseCode);
                System.out.println("Course: " + courseCode + ", Headcount: " + headCount);
            }
            System.out.println();
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using a HashMap to store the attendance data. The outer HashMap uses the dayOfMonth as the key and the inner HashMap as the value. The inner HashMap uses the courseCode as the key and the headCount as the value. 

We iterate through the input string using StringTokenizer and extract the courseCode, dayOfMonth, and headCount. We then check if the dayOfMonth already exists in the attendanceMap. If it does, we retrieve the inner HashMap for that dayOfMonth and add/update the headCount for the courseCode. If the dayOfMonth does not exist, we create a new inner HashMap, add the headCount for the courseCode, and add the inner HashMap to the attendanceMap.

Finally, we print the attendance data by iterating through the attendanceMap and its inner HashMaps.
